    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    ArrayComponent<S,T,E>
    Methods that all array validators must contain.
    BigDecimalValidator
    Validates the state of a BigDecimal.
    BigIntegerValidator
    Validates the state of a BigInteger.
    BooleanValidator
    Validates the state of a Boolean.
    ByteArrayValidator
    Validates the state of an byte[].
    ByteValidator
    Validates the state of a Byte.
    CharacterValidator
    Validates the state of a Character.
    CheckReturnValue
    Indicates that the result of a method call should not be ignored.
    CollectionComponent<S,E>
    Methods that all Collection validators must contain.
    CollectionValidator<T,E>
    Validates the state of a Collection.
    ComparableComponent<S,T>
    Methods that all Comparable validators must contain.
    ComparableValidator<T>
    Validates the state of a Comparable.
    DecimalNumberComponent<S>
    Methods that all decimal Number validators must contain.
    DefaultGuavaValidators
    Creates validators for the Guava API.
    DefaultJacksonValidators
    Creates validators for the Jackson API.
    DefaultJavaValidators
    Creates validators for the Java API.
    DoubleValidator
    Validates the state of a Double.
    FixedPrecisionDecimalNumberComponent<S>
    Methods that all fixed-precision Number validators must contain.
    FloatValidator
    Validates the state of a Float.
    GenericType<T>
    A reference to a type that may contain type parameters.
    GenericTypeValidator<T>
    Validates the state of a GenericType.
    GlobalConfiguration
    The configuration shared by all validators.
    GuavaAssertThat
    Creates validators for the Guava API that throw AssertionError immediately on validation failure.
    GuavaCheckIf
    Creates validators for the Guava API that capture exceptions on validation failure rather than throwing them immediately.
    GuavaRequireThat
    Creates validators for the Guava API that throw exceptions immediately on validation failure.
    GuavaValidators
    Creates validators for the Guava API with an independent configuration.
    InetAddressValidator
    Validates the state of an InetAddress.
    IntegerComponent<S>
    Validates the state of an Integer or int.
    IntegerValidator
    Validates the state of an Integer.
    JacksonAssertThat
    Creates validators for the Jackson API that throw AssertionError immediately on validation failure.
    JacksonCheckIf
    Creates validators for the Jackson API that capture exceptions on validation failure rather than throwing them immediately.
    JacksonRequireThat
    Creates validators for the Jackson API that throw exceptions immediately on validation failure.
    JacksonValidators
    Creates validators for the Jackson API with an independent configuration.
    JavaAssertThat
    Creates validators for the Java API that capture exceptions on validation failure rather than throwing them immediately.
    JavaCheckIf
    Creates validators for the Java API that capture exceptions on validation failure rather than throwing them immediately.
    JavaRequireThat
    Creates validators for the Java API that throw exceptions immediately on validation failure.
    JavaValidators
    Creates validators for the Java API with an independent configuration.
    JsonNodeValidator<T>
    Validates the state of a JsonNode.
    ListValidator<T,E>
    Validates the state of a List.
    LongValidator
    Validates the state of a Long.
    MapValidator<T,K,V>
    Validates the state of a Map.
    MultimapValidator<T,K,V>
    Validates the state of a Multimap, throwing an exception on the first failure.
    MultipleFailuresException
    Thrown if multiple validations have failed.
    NegativeNumberComponent<S>
    Methods that validators for numbers that may be negative must contain.
    ObjectArrayValidator<T,E>
    Validates the state of an Object[].
    ObjectComponent<S,T>
    Methods that all object validators must contain.
    ObjectValidator<T>
    Validates the state of an Object.
    OptionalValidator<T>
    Validates the state of an Optional.
    PathValidator
    Validates the state of a Path.
    PositiveNumberComponent<S>
    Methods that validators for numbers that may be positive must contain.
    PrimitiveBooleanArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a boolean[].
    PrimitiveBooleanValidator
    Validates the state of a boolean.
    PrimitiveByteArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a byte[].
    PrimitiveByteValidator
    Validates the state of a byte.
    PrimitiveCharacterArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a char[].
    PrimitiveCharacterValidator
    Validates the state of a char.
    PrimitiveDoubleArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a double[].
    PrimitiveDoubleValidator
    Validates the state of a double.
    PrimitiveFloatArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a float[].
    PrimitiveFloatValidator
    Validates the state of a float.
    PrimitiveIntegerArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a int[].
    PrimitiveIntegerComponent<S>
    Validates the state of an int.
    PrimitiveIntegerValidator
    Validates the state of an int.
    PrimitiveLongArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a long[].
    PrimitiveLongValidator
    Validates the state of a long.
    PrimitiveShortArrayValidator
    Validates the state of a short[].
    PrimitiveShortValidator
    Validates the state of a short.
    PrimitiveUnsignedIntegerValidator
    Validates the state of an int that does not support negative numbers.
    ShortValidator
    Validates the state of a Short.
    StringValidator
    Validates the state of a String.
    TerminalEncoding
    The ANSI escape codes supported by the terminal.
    UnsignedIntegerValidator
    Validates the state of an Integer that does not support negative values.
    UriValidator
    Validates the state of a URI.
    ValidationFailure
    A failed validation.
    ValidationFailures
    A collection of validation failures.
    ValidatorComponent<S,T>
    Methods that all validators must contain.
    Validators<S>
    A factory that creates different types of validators.
    ZeroNumberComponent<S>
    Methods that validators for numbers that may be zero must contain.
